net.markenwerk.utils.lrucache

Class LruCache<Key,Value>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap<Key,Value>
          • net.markenwerk.utils.lrucache.LruCache<Key,Value>
  • Type Parameters:
    Key - The key type.
    Value - The value type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Key,Value>

    public final class LruCache<Key,Value>
extends LinkedHashMap<Key,Value>
    A LruCache is a LinkedHashMap that is configured to hold it's Entries in access order and evicts the least recently accessed Map.Entry, if the configured cache size is exceeded.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LruCache

        public LruCache(int cacheSize)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new LruCache without a LruCacheListener.
        Parameters:
        cacheSize - The cache size to be used.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given cache size is negative.

      • LruCache

        public LruCache(int cacheSize,
                LruCacheListener<Key,Value> listener)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new LruCache.
        Parameters:
        cacheSize - The cache size to be used.
        listener - The LruCacheListener to be used, or null, if no LruCacheListener should be used.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given cache size is negative.
